DOC.brief_summary: Serial quantitative measurements of plasma pro-endothelin-1 concentrations in very preterm infants. Comparing pro-endothelin-1 with established clinical indices of bronchopulmonary dysplasia (BPD). Hypothesis: Pulmonary-vascular remodeling in infants developing BPD is directly related to circulating pro-endothelin-1, which therefore serves as surrogate marker of BPD.
DOC.brief_title: Prospective Study on Plasma Pro-endothelin-1 in Predicting Bronchopulmonary Dysplasia
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criteria: Very preterm infants born before 32 weeks gestational age Exclusion criteria: Severe fetal malformation, congenital heart defect, inborn syndrome, cardiomyopathy, fetal hydrops
